alert.note: Alert for Gage (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:01PM CDT until June 11 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL GAGE COUNTY... At 501 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 3 miles west of Beatrice, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Gage County, including the following locations... Ellis and Homestead National Historical Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
